page.title: 09Employment and Trade;Salem
page.content: {UNEMPLOYMENT}is almost non existent in the area. People are either farming, or they commute to neighbouring towns. ( approx. 40% ). There is a normal proportion of retired people.The Angel Inn employs a small part - time work force. There is a reasonable amount of {trade}in the area, apart from the Post Office (no shop). The village and its environs are supplied by travelling salesmen - i.e. fruit and vegetables, bread(2),fishmonger,milk roundsmen (2) - there is also a small milk depot attached to a private home, sales are available. Farm gates are also sold by a regular salesman. There is a small amount of{tourist trade;} some Bed and Breakfast is obtainable locally. The Common is of some botanical interest, and the area attracts visitors because of its outstanding natural beauty.
